snippet: Bread is a mainstay of the Syrian diet, eaten with every meal, and in Aleppo, paralyzed by two weeks of war, the bakery lines show that basic commerce has become a battleground.
abstract: Syrian rebels in Aleppo are fighting to maintain control of wheat warehouses and keep the city's bakeries operating, countering the government's attempts to keep bread and other resources out of opposition-controlled areas; struggle is part of a much larger fight over the Syrian economy, especially in Aleppo, the country's commercial hub.

byline.original: By an EMPLOYEE of THE NEW YORK TIMES in SYRIA and DAMIEN CAVE
byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times reported from Aleppo, and Damien Cave from Beirut, Lebanon. Dalal Mawad and Hawaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Bread is a mainstay of the Syrian diet, eaten with every meal, and in Aleppo, paralyzed by two weeks of war, the bakery lines show that basic commerce has become a battleground.

headline.main: For Rebel Fight in Syrian City, Baking Bread Is Urgent Task
headline.print_headline: Bread Is Staple As Syria Rebels Press Strategy

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
